ygData.messageBody:
I have not sold or heard of being sold, a single forge weapon on my server.
Tried to dump them at cost and then tried to GIVE them away for free (in the
commonlands, during prime time). Players simply don't want them. Lol, very
few want FS either (been just dumping them on vendors due to extreme lack of
interest). The ONLY way these would become a viable item is if they became
able to hit magic (and I mean for the same price/difficulty of producing
them now). My thoughts on this are that almost none of the new characters
moving from newbieland into their early teens are non-twinked. Seeing ALOT
of level 1 to 5 players with full bronze (my smith RARELY gets asked to
twink banded or even get the occassional order of a piece or 2 by legitimate
new players), magic weapons, and Flowing Black Robes etc.

> Date: Sun, 24 Oct 1999 17:42:54 -0500
> From: Darrell Runyan <runyan@...>
> Subject: Re: Forged Weapons
>
> I think the problem with pricing and manufacturing costs on the new
> weapons is due to the disparity between what Verant thinks the weapons
> are worth and what the players will actually pay for them. The store
> prices on most fine steel weapons is from 30-40 pp in the shops, but you
> can buy them by the tons on Karana for 4-8 pp each from players. That
> won't cover the costs of our molds, much less taking failures into
> account.
>
> Most people I know want magic weapons by the time they are 15th level so
> they can hunt critters you need magic weapons for. Prior to 15th level
> it doesn't really matter much what you use for a weapon. I think the
> weapons are a nice idea, but Verant needs to rethink the component costs
> and get them in line with reality.
>
> Leatherwood
